question: A motor-cyclist moving towards a huge cliff with a speed of <katex>$18 \text{ kmh}^{-1}$</katex>, blows a horn of source frequency 325 Hz. If the speed of the sound in air is <katex>$330 \text{ ms}^{-1}$</katex>, the number of beats heard by him is
explanation: Observer speed <katex>$v_o = 18 \text{ km/h} = 5 \text{ m/s}$</katex>. Source speed <katex>$v_s = 5 \text{ m/s}$</katex>.
Frequency received by cliff and reflected back is <katex>$f' = f \frac{v}{v-v_s}$</katex>.
Frequency heard by cyclist (echo) <katex>$f'' = f' \frac{v+v_o}{v} = f \frac{v+v_o}{v-v_s}$</katex>.
